meanings.def: connected with soldiers, especially in large groups

examples: They announced the withdrawal of 12 000 troops from the area.
The president decided to send in the troops.

meanings.def: one group of soldiers, especially in tanks or on horses
examples: (figurative) A troop of guests was moving towards the house.

meanings.def: to walk somewhere together as a group
examples: After lunch we all trooped down to the beach.
As the players trooped off the field, someone threw a bottle from the crowd.
The girls trooped in for dinner.
